column2: When it was the Seventy-second Night,
column3: When it was the Seventy second Night,

column2: Thou must know who it was, seeing that thou art awake." The Fireman feared for Zau al- Makan and said in himself, "Haply the Eunuch will do him some hurt"; so he answered, "By Allah, I know not who it was." Said the Eunuch, "By Allah, thou liest, for there is none on wake here but thou!
column3: Thou must know who it was, seeing that thou art awake." The Fireman feared for Zau al Makan and said in himself, "Haply the Eunuch will do him some hurt"; so he answered, "By Allah, I know not who it was." Said the Eunuch, "By Allah, thou liest, for there is none on wake here but thou!

column2: He who recited the first time hath recited a second time and I heard him hard by.
column3: He who recited the first time hath recited a second time and I heard him hard by.

column2: If he refuse, hand to him this purse of a thousand diners, then leave him and return to me and tell me, after thou hast informed thyself of his place and his calling and what countryman he is.
column3: If he refuse, hand to him this purse of a thousand diners, then leave him and return to me and tell me, after thou hast informed thyself of his place and his calling and what countryman he is.

column2: Return quickly and linger not."--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased saying her permitted say.
column3: Return quickly and linger not."--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased saying her permitted say.

column2: Thou wottest none can stir from his place, except the watchman seize him.
column3: Thou wottest none can stir from his place, except the watchman seize him.

column2: If thou fear no one, I fear for thee and for my life, so Allah upon thee! recite nothing more of verses till thou come to thine own land.
column3: If thou fear no one, I fear for thee and for my life, so Allah upon thee! recite nothing more of verses till thou come to thine own land.

column2: Indeed, I had not deemed thee so ill conditioned.
column3: Indeed, I had not deemed thee so ill conditioned.

column2: Dost thou not know that this lady is the wife; of the Chamberlain and is minded to chastise thee for disturbing her?
column3: Dost thou not know that this lady is the wife; of the Chamberlain and is minded to chastise thee for disturbing her?

column2: Then said the Eunuch to Zau al-Makan, "Peace be with thee, O my lord!"
column3: Then said the Eunuch to Zau al Makan, "Peace be with thee, O my lord!"

column2: When it was the Seventy-fourth Night,
column3: When it was the Seventy fourth Night,

column2: So the Castrato began to speak him fair and say to him, "O my lord, take this purse and go with me.
column3: So the Castrato began to speak him fair and say to him, "O my lord, take this purse and go with me.
